course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Research Methods in the Social Sciences
course.description: The course is designed to assist students in developing a basic understanding of qualitative and quantitative data analysis and interpretation in the social sciences. Background knowledge of statistics is not required for taking this course. Not to be taken by students admitted to BSc Quantitative Social Analysis from 2022-23 and onwards.

reviews.author: alexchw
reviews.comment_content: Different research method of Social Science can be clearly described, good.
reviews.comment_teaching: I do think professor has enthusiasm on her teaching by providing different examples and social issues when introducing the topics, which can make the topics and knowledge easier to understand. Besides, Prof. Miao is very nice who is willing to answer the questions of students throughout the email and after lesson. She also provides quite a lot of useful feedback to the reading report and group project to students, which can help improve the performance of us in the presentation next time.
reviews.comment_grading:
The assessments of the course will be composed of five parts.
20% - Short responses to prompts at the Canvas site in advance of class (Discussion Prompt)
15% - Research proposal – written
20% - Reading Report – written
25% - Group presentations
20% - Class participation (Attendence)
In the end of semester, the TA will release the final marks and statistics of the course generally.
My mark
Research Proposal: 15/15
Group Presentation: 22.4/25
Class Participation: 19/20
Discussion Prompt: 20/20
Reading Report: 20/20
Total: 96.4/100 (A)
Mean: 85.9
S.D: 13
付出多少，就得到多少，不上心爛grade必然，但過程不算辛苦，好grade course.
reviews.comment_workload:
For the 2000 course, I do think the workload is relatively light, which only includes:
Group Presentation X3
Group Research Proposal X1
Individual Reading Report X1
Weekly discussion Prompt X12

For the reading report, only 3 pages needed for commenting the research report. The content is quite flexible, just use the knowledge taught in class will be okay. Consultation to the prof. through the email before the submission will be okay to get the ideal grade for the reading report.

For the weekly discussion prompt, it includes different social issues which links the knowledge taught in class. Just submit in canvas every week will be okay.

reviews.author: cly__
reviews.title: Groupmates are VERY VERY VERY IMPORTANT
reviews.comment_content: A blended-learning course about different research methods (e.g. quantitative & qualitative) and how to design a research proposal.  Professor adopted a 'learning-by-doing' approach, that means very few PPT slides :DD
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Stuart is nice and passionate in teaching.  He expected us to turn on the camera and interact with him.  

He arranged 2 interviews for us, which were quite interesting as we could actually interview those ethnic minorities in Hong Kong.  The field trip to Mosque was postponed due to Covid.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading (Work harder = Better grade)

Reflection logs are very important if you want to get a good grade.  The mean for each reflection log is usually 4.5 - 4.7 (A- to A) and getting a B range will definitely affects your grading.  To get an A+ (5/5), you will need to demonstrate self-learning skills (i.e. discuss related learning materials + cite references)

Groupmates are very very important as you will need to work with them throughout the semester.  Better find some friends to study with you or else the course can be a PAINFUL TORTURE. Professor and TA will keep track of your progress and you will need to submit a draft for the research proposal.


A for both research proposal & presentation, and A+ for most reflection logs --> Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy Workload but NO examinations

2 Rounds of Interviews (will NOT be counted towards the final grade)
- Prepare interview questions in advance
- Presentation about interview findings (1st Interview only)

1 Group Project (base on assigned reading)
- Presentation (~5%)
- Research Proposal (~32%)

Reflection Log EVERY WEEK (~ 63%, including 5% from a class activity)
- 5% each and 8% for the last one, summarizing what you have learnt + project progress
